Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
  Simulation

public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object

A simulation consists for now of a list of users and a list of documents. "Running" the simulation consists of iterating through the users and asking them to "act". The simulation also provides a search method to the users so they can retrieve the top documents.

Version:
assign2
Author:
babak

          Initialize the simulation with an empty list of users and documents

          Initialize the simulation with nbUsers and nbDocs, each given a random tag/taste upon creation.

static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
          create a simulation, and run it
 void run()
          A simulation run consists of: 1- pick a user (for now just pick them in order from the list) 2- get the user to act
 java.util.ArrayList<Document> search()

 java.lang.String toString()
          return a string representation of the simulation, which for now consists of a list of users separated by a carriage return ("\n")

Constructor Detail

Simulation

public Simulation()
Initialize the simulation with an empty list of users and documents

Simulation

public Simulation(int nbUsers,
                  int nbDocs)
Initialize the simulation with nbUsers and nbDocs, each given a random tag/taste upon creation. Users can be Consumer or Producer; the choice between the two should also be made at random.

add the supplied document to the list of documents

add the supplied user to the list of users

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
create a simulation, and run it

run

public void run()
A simulation run consists of: 1- pick a user (for now just pick them in order from the list) 2- get the user to act

search

public java.util.ArrayList<Document> search()
return top documents according to some strategy. For now just return them all

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
return a string representation of the simulation, which for now consists of a list of users separated by a carriage return ("\n")
